sentence.text: Hearing impairment (HI) caused by mutations in the connexin-26 gene (gap junction-mediated intercellular transport) accounts for the majority of cases with inherited, nonsyndromic sensorineural hearing loss.
This study describes the first use of pentose-phosphate shunt, oxidative branch for gap junction-mediated intercellular transport associated non-syndromic deafness in Iran.

gap junction-mediated intercellular transport donor splicing site IVS1+1G&gt;A mutation analysis was performed using Sanger sequencing for a total of 71 Iranian families with at least 1 deaf child diagnosed with non-syndromic deafness.
